scheduler.db.preferencesdb
Class NoClassOverlap

java.lang.Object
  scheduler.db.preferencesdb.SchedulePreference
      scheduler.db.preferencesdb.NoClassOverlap
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<NoClassOverlap>
public class NoClassOverlap
extends SchedulePreference
implements java.lang.Comparable<NoClassOverlap>, java.io.Serializable

Represent the schedule preference which specifies which courses should not be scheduled for times which overlap. For example think Winter Quarter, CSC courses: most students take 102 and 141 at the same time. So, those two courses should be not be scheduled at times which conflict, so that students are able to attend both courses. Duplicate courses are not allowed.

Author:
Eric Liebowitz
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

NoClassOverlap

public NoClassOverlap(java.lang.String name,
                      int weight,
                      java.util.HashSet<Course> cs)
Builds a preference for which courses should not overlap.

Parameters:
name - The name this preference will be referred to as
weight - The priority (0 to 10...10 is non violatable)
cs - The list of courses that cannot overlap. (Note that this can can be appended to). A deep copy of this set is made.

NoClassOverlap

public NoClassOverlap(java.lang.String name,
                      int weight,
                      java.util.Collection<Course> cs)
Builds a preference for which courses should not overlap.

Parameters:
name - The name this preference will be referred to as
weigh - The priority (0 to 10...10 is non-violatable)
cs - A collection of courses which will be allowed to overlap. This collection's items will be added to the AbstractCollection of courses, so as to ensure that no duplicates are entered

public java.util.BitSet getBitSet()

public boolean equals(NoClassOverlap nco)
Compares to NCO objects, checking whether their HashSet of Courses are equals. Since this simply calls the equals method for Vector, it's really the equals method for Course's that you want to look into
